member.name: Windows.CreatePropertySheetPage
member.summary: Creates a new page for a property sheet.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that defines a page to be included in a property sheet.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the new property page if successful, or NULL otherwise.

member.name: Windows.CreatePropertySheetPageA
member.summary: Creates a new page for a property sheet.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that defines a page to be included in a property sheet.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the new property page if successful, or NULL otherwise.

member.name: Windows.CreatePropertySheetPageW
member.summary: Creates a new page for a property sheet.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that defines a page to be included in a property sheet.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the new property page if successful, or NULL otherwise.

member.name: Windows.CreatePropertySheetPage
member.summary: Creates a new page for a property sheet.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that defines a page to be included in a property sheet.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the new property page if successful, or NULL otherwise.

member.name: Windows.CreatePropertySheetPageA
member.summary: Creates a new page for a property sheet.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that defines a page to be included in a property sheet.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the new property page if successful, or NULL otherwise.

member.name: Windows.CreatePropertySheetPageW
member.summary: Creates a new page for a property sheet.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that defines a page to be included in a property sheet.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the new property page if successful, or NULL otherwise.

member.name: Windows.DestroyPropertySheetPage
member.summary: Destroys a property sheet page. An application must call this function for pages that have not been passed to the function.
member.param: Handle to the property sheet page to delete.
member.returns: Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PropertySheet
member.summary: Creates a property sheet and adds the pages defined in the specified property sheet header structure.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that defines the frame and pages of a property sheet.

returns.para: For modal property sheets, the return value is as follows:

listheader.description: Changes were saved by the user.
No changes were saved by the user.

returns.para: For modeless property sheets, the return value is the property sheet's window handle.
The following return values have a special meaning.

listheader.description: A page sent the PSM_REBOOTSYSTEM message to the property sheet. The computer must be restarted for the user's changes to take effect.
A page sent the PSM_RESTARTWINDOWS message to the property sheet. Windows must be restarted for the user's changes to take effect.

member.name: Windows.PropertySheetA
member.summary: Creates a property sheet and adds the pages defined in the specified property sheet header structure.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that defines the frame and pages of a property sheet.

returns.para: For modal property sheets, the return value is as follows:

listheader.description: Changes were saved by the user.
No changes were saved by the user.

returns.para: For modeless property sheets, the return value is the property sheet's window handle.
The following return values have a special meaning.

listheader.description: A page sent the PSM_REBOOTSYSTEM message to the property sheet. The computer must be restarted for the user's changes to take effect.
A page sent the PSM_RESTARTWINDOWS message to the property sheet. Windows must be restarted for the user's changes to take effect.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_AddPage
member.summary: Adds a new page to the end of an existing property sheet. You can use this macro or send the PSM_ADDPAGE message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the page to add. The page must have been created by a previous call to the function.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_Apply
member.summary: Simulates the selection of the Apply button, indicating that one or more pages have changed and the changes need to be validated and recorded. You can use this macro or send the PSM_APPLY message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_CancelToClose
member.summary: Used when changes made since the most recent PSN_APPLY notification cannot be canceled. You can also send a PSM_CANCELTOCLOSE message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_Changed
member.summary: Informs a property sheet that information in a page has changed. You can use this macro or send the PSM_CHANGED message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the page that has changed.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_EnableWizButtons
member.summary: Enables or disables buttons in an Aero wizard. You can use this macro or send the PSM_ENABLEWIZBUTTONS message explicitly.

param.name: dwState
param.para: One or more of the following values that specify which property sheet buttons are to be enabled. If a button value is included in both this parameter and dwMask, it is enabled.

member.param: One or more of the same values used in dwState, specifying which buttons are affected by this call. If a button value appears in this parameter but not in dwState, the button is disabled.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_GetCurrentPageHwnd
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the window of the current page of a property sheet. You can use this macro or send the PSM_GETCURRENTPAGEHWND message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_GetResult
member.summary: Used by modeless property sheets to retrieve the information returned to modal property sheets by . You can use this macro or sent the PSM_GETRESULT message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the property sheet's dialog box.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_GetTabControl
member.summary: Retrieves the handle to the tab control of a property sheet. You can use this macro or send the PSM_GETTABCONTROL message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_HwndToIndex
member.summary: Takes a window handle of the property sheet page and returns its zero-based index. You can use this macro or send the PSM_HWNDTOINDEX message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the property sheet's window.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_IdToIndex
member.summary: Takes the resource identifier (ID) of a property sheet page and returns its zero-based index. You can use this macro or send the PSM_IDTOINDEX message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the property sheet window.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_IndexToHwnd
member.summary: Takes the index of a property sheet page and returns its window handle. You can use this macro or send the PSM_INDEXTOHWND message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the property sheet page's window.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_IndexToId
member.summary: Takes the index of a property sheet page and returns its resource identifier (ID). You can use this macro or send the PSM_INDEXTOID message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_IndexToPage
member.summary: Takes the index of a property sheet page and returns its HPROPSHEETPAGE handle. You can use this macro or send the PSM_INDEXTOPAGE message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the property sheet window.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_InsertPage
member.summary: Inserts a new page into an existing property sheet. The page can be inserted either at a specified index or after a specified page. You can use this macro or send the PSM_INSERTPAGE message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: Where the page is to be inserted. Set wParam to NULL to make the new page the first page. To specify where the new page is to be inserted, you can either pass an index or an existing page's HPROPSHEETPAGE handle.

listheader.description: If wParam is less than MAXUSHORT (the largest unsigned short integer), it specifies the zero-based index for the new page. For example, to make the inserted page the third page on the property sheet, set index to 2. To make it the first page, set index to 0. If index has a value greater than the number of pages and less than MAXUSHORT, the page will be appended.
If you set wParam to an existing page's HPROPSHEETPAGE handle, the new page will be inserted after it.

member.param: Handle to the page to be inserted. The page must first be created by a call to the function.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_IsDialogMessage
member.summary: Passes a message to a property sheet dialog box and indicates whether the dialog box processed the message. You can use this macro or send the PSM_ISDIALOGMESSAGE message explicitly.
member.param: Pointer to an structure that contains the message to be checked.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_PageToIndex
member.summary: Takes the HPROPSHEETPAGE handle of a property sheet page and returns its zero-based index. You can use this macro or send the PSM_PAGETOINDEX message explicitly.
member.param: HPROPSHEETPAGE handle to the property sheet page.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_PressButton
member.summary: Simulates the selection of a property sheet button. You can use this macro or send the PSM_PRESSBUTTON message explicitly.

param.name: iButton
param.para: Index of the button to select. This parameter can be one of the following values:

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_QuerySiblings
member.summary: Causes a property sheet to send the PSM_QUERYSIBLINGS message to each of its pages. You can use this macro or send the PSM_QUERYSIBLINGS message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_RebootSystem
member.summary: Indicates the system needs to be restarted for the changes to take effect. You can use this macro or send the PSM_REBOOTSYSTEM message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_RecalcPageSizes
member.summary: Recalculates the page size of a standard or wizard property sheet after pages have been added or removed. You can use this macro or send the PSM_RECALCPAGESIZES message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the property sheet's dialog box.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_RemovePage
member.summary: Removes a page from a property sheet. You can use this macro or send the PSM_REMOVEPAGE message explicitly.
member.param: Zero-based index of the page to be removed.
Handle to the page to be removed.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_RestartWindows
member.summary: Sends a PSM_RESTARTWINDOWS message indicating that Windows needs to be restarted for changes to take effect. You can use this macro or send the PSM_RESTARTWINDOWS message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetButtonText
member.summary: Sets the text of a button in an Aero wizard. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETBUTTONTEXT message explicitly.

param.name: dwButton
param.para: One of the following values specifying the button whose text is set.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetCurSel
member.summary: Activates the specified page in a property sheet. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETCURSEL message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the page to activate. An application can specify the index or the handle, or both. If both are specified, hpage takes precedence.
Zero-based index of the page. An application can specify the index or the handle, or both. If both are specified, hpage takes precedence.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetCurSelByID
member.summary: Activates the specified page in a property sheet based on the resource identifier of the page. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETCURSELID message explicitly.
member.param: Resource identifier of the page to activate.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetFinishText
member.summary: Sets the text of the Finish button in a wizard, shows and enables the button, and hides the Next and Back buttons. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETFINISHTEXT message explicitly.
member.param: Window handle (HWND) of the wizard property sheet.
Pointer to the new text for the Finish button.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetHeaderSubTitle
member.summary: Sets the subtitle text for the header of a wizard's interior page. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETHEADERSUBTITLE message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetHeaderTitle
member.summary: Sets the title text for the header of a wizard's interior page. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETHEADERTITLE message explicitly.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetNextText
member.summary: Sets the text of the Next button in a wizard. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETNEXTTEXT message explicitly.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that contains the text.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetTitle
member.summary: Sets the title of a property sheet. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETTITLE message explicitly.
member.param: Flag that indicates whether to include the prefix "Properties for" with the specified title string. If dwStyle is the PSH_PROPTITLE value, the prefix is included. Otherwise, the prefix is not used.
Pointer to a buffer that contains the title string. If the HIWORD of this parameter is NULL, the property sheet loads the string resource specified in the LOWORD.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_SetWizButtons
member.summary: Enables or disables the Back, Next, and Finish buttons in a wizard by posting a PSM_SETWIZBUTTONS message. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SETWIZBUTTONS message explicitly.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A value that specifies which wizard buttons are enabled. You can combine one or more of the following flags.

listheader.description: Enable the Back button. If this flag is not set, the Back button is displayed as disabled.
Enable the Next button. If this flag is not set, the Next button is displayed as disabled.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_ShowWizButtons
member.summary: Show or hide buttons in a wizard. You can use this macro or send the PSM_SHOWWIZBUTTONS message explicitly.

param.name: dwFlag
param.para: One or more of the following values that specify which property sheet buttons are to be shown. If a button value is included in both this parameter and dwButton then it is shown.

listheader.description: Set only this flag (defined as zero) to hide all buttons specified in dwButton.

member.param: One or more of the same values used in dwFlag. Here, they specify which property sheet buttons are to be shown or hidden. If a button value appears in this parameter but not in dwFlag, it indicates that the button should be hidden.

member.name: Windows.PropSheet_UnChanged
member.summary: Informs a property sheet that information in a page has reverted to the previously saved state. You can use this macro or send the PSM_UNCHANGED message explicitly.
member.param: Handle to the page that has reverted to the previously saved state.
